item.title: How-to Wear Your Hijab as a Green Nikkah Jewelry Backdrop
item.description: Hijab-proud. @anisha_mua shows us how to flaunt the hijab in the best way - layering green nikkah jewelry on top.
item.content:encoded:
Stop right there. The halal press-on nails! The whole look is lit though. Instead of tucking in her hijab, @anisha.mua displays it full force and hangs her nikkah jewelry delicately on top, on the side... and in the front. Showing us that we don't have to hide the hijab for our bridal look. Get more style inspiration from our Green Muslim Wedding Shop.

Naturally a green bridal hijab would go nice with this too, but a neutral color like champagne just sets off the entire look. I like how she left her hijab loose and added a choker. The loose look is totally necessary for this so everything flows. You can do this!
item.dc:creator: Hijabi Bridal

item.title: How-to Wear A White Layered Hijab with a Wedding Veil/ Dupatta
item.description: Always wanted that super-neat layered look? Now you can have it with your white Muslim wedding dresses! @isanawin_makeup shows you exactly how to layer your hijab. Surprise at the end!
item.category:
Style Videos

Did you see that?! So quick and neat. She tucked the edges right into the collar. Then the veil / dupatta rests on the top. If your collar isn't high, you can still tuck the edges into your neckline and use a few hidden pins to keep it there. Try this look with one of our white Muslim wedding dresses, Moroccan wedding kaftan or Muslim lehengas. Get more style inspiration from our White Muslim Wedding Shop.

Usually an organza hijab is used with a white hijab wedding dress, then the decorated veil goes over that. So seeing a chiffon hijab with a decorated edge was a bit of a surprise. We had to include it. The trick here is to have plenty of straight pins on hand and to manipulate the fabric slowly. You can do it!
item.dc:creator: Hijabi Bridal

item.title: How-to Wear Your Champagne Bridal Hijab to the Back: So it Doesn't Show Under a Dupatta
item.description: If you're wearing your bridal hijab to the back, @amberglams shows you just how to disguise it under your dupatta and cover your neck with jewelry. View our Champagne Collection for more inspiration.
item.category:
Style Videos

One of our champagne Muslim wedding dresses or Muslim lehengas will not hurt you here! Most of them come with a matching shawl/dupatta, so you can get the look. Get more style inspiration from our Champagne Muslim Wedding Shop.

So what's the trick? She used a matching shade of champagne for her satin hijab. She pinned it to the back and when she put the dupatta over it, she fluffed it a little so that it would fall into the folds of the hijab. Perfection. Then she used a large necklace to cover her chest area. Her dupatta is also draped over one arm for more effect, girl. And there you have it.
